means: 喂肥( fatten的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The cattle are being fattened for slaughter.
They fattened up ducks and geese.
The piglets are taken from the sow to be fattened for market.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些小猪被从母猪身边带走，好育肥上市。

PerfectNetExp.abs: The pigs are fattened up for market ., 把猪养肥以供应市场.
the servant said to him ,' Your brother has returned and your father has slaughtered the fattened calf because he has him back safe and sound .'仆人向他说：你弟弟回来了，你父亲因为见他无恙归来，便为他宰了那只肥牛犊
take fattened calf and kill it . we shall a feast .再把那只肥牛犊牵来宰了，我们应吃喝欢宴。
And fattened as on a honey - comb ., 犹如在一个蜜蜂巢中长大的幸运儿.

entry.def: If an animal is fattened, or if it fattens, it becomes fatter as a result of eating more.

example.ex: The cattle are being fattened for slaughter...
The creature continued to grow and fatten.
example.tran: 这个家伙继续长大、变肥。

entry.tran: 使(企业)发财;使(利润)增长;为…牟利
entry.def: If you say that someone is fattening something such as a business or its profits, you mean that they are increasing the value of the business or its profits, in a way that you disapprove of.

example.ex: They have kept the price of sugar artificially high and so fattened the company's profits.
example.tran: 他们一直人为地使糖的价格居高不下，以此为公司牟利。

means.word_mean: 1. (of market animals) made ready for market
